meanings.definition: Workers who work outside of a central office or location.
meanings.sent1: The outworkers gathered in the park to discuss their projects.
meanings.sent2: Many companies now hire outworkers to complete tasks from home.
meanings.sent3: The outworkers decided to have a picnic outside the office building.
meanings.sent4: The outworkers were like busy bees buzzing around different locations.
meanings.sent5: The outworkers painted a colorful picture of productivity outside the office.

meanings.definition: People who work remotely or from home.
meanings.sent1: Outworkers often communicate with their colleagues through online meetings.
meanings.sent2: Some outworkers prefer the flexibility of working from home.
meanings.sent3: The outworkers had a virtual dance party during their break.
meanings.sent4: She was an outworker, a lone wolf in the digital wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The outworkers' virtual workspace was a hub of creativity and collaboration.
